titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the F. Bruce Lamb papers, 1930-1994

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Caitlin Lampman July 2012>

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: F. Bruce Lamb papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

langmaterial.label: Language(s)
langmaterial.language: Majority of material is in English. Some materials in Spanish, Portuguese, and German.

did.abstract: Personal papers of F. Bruce Lamb (1913-1992) a tropical forestry expert and writer; The collection contains his work as a professional forester, and his books on Manuel Cordova-Rios, an Amazon medicine man, and Harvey Logan, alias Kid Curry, and the Wild Bunch.

bioghist.head: Biography of F. Bruce Lamb
bioghist.p: F. Bruce Lamb (1913-1992) was a tropical forestry expert and writer. A graduate of the University of Michigan, School of Forestry, he wrote his doctoral dissertation on mahogany. During WWII Lamb traveled to Brazil as part of the Rubber Development Corporation in an effort by the United States to develop a rubber production program. After the war, his work as a consultant and with multiple forestry agencies, and eventually his employment with U.S. Plywood Corporation lead him to work throughout South America, Southeast Asia and parts of Africa. While working in the Amazon, Lamb met Manuel Cordova-Rios, who studied Amazonian medicinal plants under a Huni Kui (Cashinawa) shaman. Lamb wrote several books on the life and work of Cordova-Rios. In addition to his books on Cordova-Rios, Lamb, a native Coloradoan, collected family stories about Harvey Logan, alias Kid Curry, a member of the Wild Bunch, who visited the family ranch. Lamb published a book on the life of Kid Curry as well as an annotated bibliography on the Wild Bunch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Lamb’s work as a forester; including maps, photographs, and research materials on his dissertation on mahogany, as well as correspondence, reports, maps, photographs and articles from his professional travels. The collection also includes drafts, notes, correspondence, and research files about Manuel Cordova-Rios and the Amazon; Kid Curry and the Wild Bunch; and Lamb’s unpublished book on ecology. Personal materials like daily calendars, notebooks, passports and travel documents, and employment records are also included.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by F. Bruce Lamb at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from F. Bruce Lamb 1971-1992, Elizabeth Lamb (wife) 1993-1996, and John Lamb (brother) 1995.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed July 2012 by Caitlin Lampman.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

did.unittitle: Series I. Personal

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically. Contains personal calendars, notes, employment records, and passports, and other travel documents; Graduation programs for the University of Michigan, and obituaries and memorial service information.

Series II. Professional Work and Research

scopecontent.p: Primarily reports, surveys, maps, memos, photogrpahs, pertinent correspondence, and printed materials regarding Lamb’s forestry assignments. Materials are grouped by country or company as arranged by Lamb. The arrangement was maintained, and material is listed alphabetically within each sub-series.

Series III. Publications and Writings

scopecontent.p: Drafts, research materials including newspaper clippings, articles, and printed materials, in addition to correspondence for published and unpublished articles and books written by Lamb.

did.unittitle: Sub-series 1. Articles

scopecontent.p: Articles topically cover forestry, environmental and ecology issues, reactions and defense of “Wizard of the Upper Amazon”, and articles on Kid Curry and the Wild Bunch. Correspondence and any drafts are grouped with the published article. Articles are arranged chronologically.
